abstracts.cdata!:
The Third Programmatic Business
            Productivity and Efficiency Development Policy Loan for
            Colombia will be executed over a period of three years. This
            operation will support policy and institutional reforms in
            three areas: strengthening of fiscal management, the
            financial system and capital markets; improvement of the
            quality standards and technological innovation framework;
            and strengthening of infrastructure and logistics. The loan
            will support sustainable growth and alleviation of poverty
            by: facilitating the operation of businesses, and promoting
            investment to boost productivity, and employment levels; and
            consolidating the financial sector and capital markets as
            pillars of economic growth to address the needs of
            individuals (particularly the poor and underserved), and the
            productive sector. The combination of domestic economic
            growth, improved international conditions, Colombian peso
            appreciation, and revenue-enhancing policy reforms has
            benefited the country's fiscal accounts, as did
            improvements in tax administration. Revenue growth has
            continued to outpace gross domestic product (GDP) growth and
            as a result the general Government deficit decreased from
            4.9 percent of GDP in 2002 to about 1.9 percent of GDP in
            2007. The near stagnation of the economy during the early
            2000s has given way to sustained economic growth and a
            strengthening of consumer and investor confidence. The
            turnaround was influenced by an improve global economic
            environment in which demand for Colombia's primary
            exports has risen along with prices, while the cost of
            international borrowing has fallen. Sound macroeconomic
            management has played a major part in the recovery as well
            as improvements in internal security.
